feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [orchid/platform] Orchid Platform has Method Exposure Vulnerability in Modals
entry.content:
Impact

This vulnerability is a method exposure issue (CWE-749: Exposed Dangerous Method or Function) in the Orchid Platform’s asynchronous modal functionality, affecting users of Orchid Platform version 8 through 14.42.x. Attackers could exploit this vulnerability to call arbitrary methods within the Screen class, leading to potential brute force of database tables, validation checks against user credentials, and disclosure of the server’s real IP address.

Patches

The issue has been patched in the latest release, version 14.43.0, released on November 6, 2024. Users should upgrade to version 14.43.0 or later to address this vulnerability.

Workarounds

If upgrading to version 14.43.0 is not immediately possible, you can mitigate the vulnerability by implementing middleware to intercept and validate requests to asynchronous modal endpoints, allowing only approved methods and parameters.

References

  • CWE-749: Exposed Dangerous Method or Function

Acknowledgements

We would like to extend our sincere gratitude to Positive Technologies and researcher Vladislav Gladky for identifying the vulnerability and their significant contribution to enhancing the security of our platform. Their expertise and dedication play a crucial role in making Orchid more reliable and secure for all users.

References

  • https://github.com/orchidsoftware/platform/security/advisories/GHSA-cm46-gqf4-mv4f
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51992
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cm46-gqf4-mv4f

entry.title: [twig/twig] Twig has unguarded calls to `__isset()` and to array-accesses when the sandbox is enabled
entry.content:
Description

In a sandbox, and attacker can access attributes of Array-like objects as they were not checked by the security policy. They are now checked via the property policy and the __isset() method is now called after the security check. This is a BC break.

Resolution

The sandbox mode now ensures access to array-like's properties is allowed.

The patch for this issue is available here for the 3.11.x branch, and here for the 3.x branch.

Credits

We would like to thank Jamie Schouten for reporting the issue and Nicolas Grekas for providing the fix.

References

  • https://github.com/twigphp/Twig/security/advisories/GHSA-jjxq-ff2g-95vh
  • https://github.com/twigphp/Twig/commit/831c148e786178e5f2fde9db67266be3bf241c21
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51755
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/twig/twig/CVE-2024-51755.yaml
  • https://symfony.com/blog/unguarded-calls-to-__isset-and-to-array-accesses-when-the-sandbox-is-enabled
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jjxq-ff2g-95vh

entry.content:
Description

In a sandbox, and attacker can access attributes of Array-like objects as they were not checked by the security policy. They are now checked via the property policy and the __isset() method is now called after the security check. This is a BC break.

Resolution

The sandbox mode now ensures access to array-like's properties is allowed.

The patch for this issue is available here for the 3.11.x branch, and here for the 3.x branch.

Credits

References

  • https://github.com/twigphp/Twig/security/advisories/GHSA-jjxq-ff2g-95vh

entry.title: [twig/twig] Twig has unguarded calls to `__toString()` when nesting an object into an array
entry.content:
Description

In a sandbox, an attacker can call __toString() on an object even if the __toString() method is not allowed by the security policy when the object is part of an array or an argument list (arguments to a function or a filter for instance).

Resolution

The sandbox mode now checks the __toString() method call on all objects.

The patch for this issue is available here for the 3.11.x branch, and here for the 3.x branch.

Credits

We would like to thank Jamie Schouten for reporting the issue and Fabien Potencier for providing the fix.

References

  • https://github.com/twigphp/Twig/security/advisories/GHSA-6377-hfv9-hqf6
  • https://github.com/twigphp/Twig/commit/2bb8c2460a2c519c498df9b643d5277117155a73
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-51754
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/twig/twig/CVE-2024-51754.yaml
  • https://symfony.com/blog/unguarded-calls-to-__tostring-when-nesting-an-object-into-an-array
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6377-hfv9-hqf6

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle LFI vulnerability when restoring malformed block backups
entry.content:
A flaw was found in moodle. A local file may include risks when restoring block backups.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43440
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304269
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461210
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qrqv-26gf-xgwh

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle's IDOR in Feedback non-respondents report allows messaging arbitrary site users
entry.content:
A flaw was found in Feedback. Bulk messaging in the activity's non-respondents report did not verify message recipients belonging to the set of users returned by the report.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43438
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304267
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461208
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p9cx-f595-h79h

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to site administration SQL injection via XMLDB editor
entry.content:
A SQL injection risk flaw was found in the XMLDB editor tool available to site administrators.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43436
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304264
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461206
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mx26-62xm-2p83

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle has CSRF risk in Feedback non-respondents report
entry.content:
The bulk message sending feature in Moodle's Feedback module's non-respondents report had an incorrect CSRF token check, leading to a CSRF vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43434
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2304262
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=461203
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x87r-37q5-mmr8
